title: 144hz or Ultrawide Monitor?
body:
Hello everyone, I am thinking of buying a new monitor. I am between 144hz or Ultrawide. What would you suggest to me? Does 144hz has so much difference in LoL as in fps or not? My Budget is around 250.
Thank you for your time!

replies.body: The main hardware will be Ryzen 2600 with Gtx 1060 or a gtx 1070. I have not decided yet. But i dont think that 144 fps  is a hard target on LoL to be honest.

some people say it makes a huge difference... i say it doesn't...

 i have 2 monitors.. one 60hz... one 144hz... i _literally_ see no difference at all.. and yes the 144 one IS displaying at 144Hz. its NOT set to 60

 some people think they make a huge difference.. other people like myself... cant see ANY difference at all.

 before u buy one i recommend going to a store like fry's and looking at them to see fi YOU can actually see a difference.
'
 because personally.. i wouldn't not buy another 144 hz monitor because of how much more they cost... and i cant see a damn difference.

 even if i put a video to display half on one screen and half on the other... no difference at all.

 and i frequently use and look at both monitors...
 i woudl look at the in person before u commit to buying a 144hz..

 lowering your ping by 10 ms will make a 100x bigger difference than a 144 monitor

What hardware do you have? 144 fps is a hard target to reach on a lot of systems, even in LoL. The benefit of higher framerate is pretty minimal. It helps, but it wont make much difference unless you are already extremely good.

A 2560x1080 75Hz gives you a bigger field of view, which will be a huge help, especially for long-range champs.

Almost all of the LG 60Hz ultrawides overclock to 75Hz with no difficulties, as they use the same hardware.

Like the Unicorns said, it makes a massive difference. In any single game that requires a good reaction time for anything, 144hz is 100% better in every scenario. Especially in FPS games, if you play any. The difference between my old monitor (was a 60hz monitor) and my new one (the 144hz monitor) is tremendous when I play Ghost Recon Wildlands, Rainbow Six Siege and CSGO. I would highly recommend going with the 144hz monitor. Doesn't have to be the one I have because of course it is up to the person using it and what they want, but this monitor is excellent for what it costs. If you do decide to get this monitor or one similar, make sure to check and look at what settings the monitor comes with and other customer's reviews because sometimes the monitor will not come with the best picture quality out of the box. For instance the monitor I had needed to be tweaked to have the best picture quality. If you have any more questions, ask away :)

Thank you for your answer.  So, you have tried 144hz and it does make a noticible difference in LoL. What about an ultrawide? Have you tried it before? Is it worth the extra space that you can see?

There is a massive difference between the 144hz versus the 60hz. I have never used an ultra wide, but I dislike ultra wide monitors so I don't think my opinion matters. If you want to get an ultra wide, go for it, it is your choice. If it helps with League specifically, I am unsure but I wouldn't get one myself, but it is all personal preference. I don't mind answering questions, it makes me feel better knowing people are asking before dropping hundreds of dollars on shit that doesn't match their expectations. {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
I know that it makes a huge difference but even on LoL though?
Yes, any game where being able to react faster is an advantage makes 144 hz worth it, and League is no exception.
